[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::num_bytes()] [Byte Size Validation] Can num_bytes be set to values larger than actual network message sizes, causing resource allocation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: BatchInfo::gas_bucket_start()] [Gas Bucket Overflow] Can gas_bucket_start values exceed maximum gas limits causing integer overflow in gas calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: ProofOfStore] [Double Spending via Batch Replay] Can an attacker replay old ProofOfStore messages with valid signatures to re-execute transactions in new blocks causing double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: ProofOfStore] [Batch Withholding Attack] Can a Byzantine validator create valid ProofOfStore but withhold the actual batch data, causing other validators to accept proofs for unavailable batches? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [Quorum Manipulation] Does verify_multi_signatures check that signatures come from current epoch validators with sufficient stake, or can old validator signatures be reused? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStoreMsg::verify()] [Proof Ordering Attack] Can the order of proofs in ProofOfStoreMsg be manipulated to affect transaction execution order within blocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfoMsg::verify()] [Batch Flooding] Can an attacker send max_num_batches messages repeatedly to flood validators with signature verification work? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: SignedBatchInfo] [Concurrent Modification] Are SignedBatchInfo instances immutable after creation, or can concurrent access lead to race conditions in signature or info fields? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: ProofOfStore] [Multi-threaded Verification] Can concurrent verify() calls on the same ProofOfStore instance cause race conditions in cache access or signature checking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Type: ProofCache] [Cache Coherency] In multi-threaded environments, does the cache maintain coherency between verification threads or can stale cache entries be used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfo::verify()] [Byzantine Sender Attack] Can up to 1/3 Byzantine validators send batches with invalid signatures to waste honest validator verification resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [Byzantine Quorum Attack] If exactly 1/3 Byzantine validators participate in signatures, can they create proofs that appear valid but include malicious batch data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::shuffled_signers()] [Signer Selection Bias] Can Byzantine validators exploit the random shuffle to increase their representation in signer lists for reward manipulation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfo::new()] [Weak Signature Randomness] Does BLS signature generation use sufficient entropy, or can predictable signatures enable forgery attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [Signature Malleability] Are BLS aggregate signatures vulnerable to malleability attacks where attackers can modify signatures while keeping them valid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Derive: CryptoHash for BatchInfoExt] [Hash Function Security] Is the underlying hash function (likely SHA3-256) resistant to length extension and collision attacks for batch identification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: SignatureWithStatus] [Signature Status Bypass] Can the status field in SignatureWithStatus be manipulated to mark invalid signatures as valid? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfoMsg::verify()] [Verification Amplification] Can an attacker send messages with max_num_batches all requiring expensive BLS verification to amplify DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStoreMsg::verify()] [Aggregate Verification Cost] Are there gas limits or rate limits on proof verification to prevent resource exhaustion from proof flooding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Type: ProofCache] [Memory Exhaustion] Can validators create unlimited unique batches to fill the ProofCache, exhausting memory on honest validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Struct: BatchInfo] [Large Batch Attack] Can attackers create batches with num_bytes close to u64::MAX to cause memory allocation failures during batch processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfo::verify()] [Replay Attack] Does the system track processed batch_ids to prevent replay of old SignedBatchInfo messages with valid signatures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: ProofOfStore::verify()] [Proof Replay] Can old ProofOfStore messages be replayed after cache eviction, causing redundant verification and potential state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfoMsg::epoch()] [Cross-Epoch Replay] Does epoch checking prevent batches from old epochs being replayed in new epochs with different validator sets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/proof_of_store.rs] [Function: SignedBatchInfo::verify()] [Bail Macro Safety] Does the bail! macro properly propagate errors without leaving partial state changes that could be exploited? (Medium)
